page.title: 19Current Crazes-N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: {Disco Dancing}has been popular here for some years. Young people pay to go and dance in a darkened hall with coloured flashing lights and very loud music.{Break Dancing}can take place in a hall, but it often happens out of doors, even sometimes at street corners. Teenagers dance very energetically in time to the breakdance{music.}There are names for each movement- headspin, caterpillar,, windmill, moonwalk etc. The dancers move like robots, and other names for this pastime are Robotics and Body Popping. They use battery powered tape recorders either of the small personal type with headphones-known as Walkman- or big portable stereo cassette players.{Its a Knockout}is a team game with fun events. Players compete in a variety of silly races, often ending up very wet or covered in custard.
